comment: I wouldn't recommend Professor Yeboah to students who struggle in Math. She is flighty, scatter- brained and has a hard time keeping up with her own material. She tries her best to help by being available and offering study sessions but these instances are few and far between. She usually goes past class time and her tests are extremely difficult.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Yeboah cared a lot about her students and wanted to see them succeed. There are a ton of pop quizzes that are over things vaguely covered in class and the tests were pretty hard. Sometimes her lectures were hard to keep up with because of how fast she went and were often all over the place.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Miss Anna is a wonderful teacher. She teaches everything you need to know and doesn't make the tests or quizzes hard. The homework problems are reasonable too. She really wants all of us to do well and is always available to talk and clear any doubts. Do take her, your grade will improve.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Yeboah is the best math teacher I've ever had! She was always very helpful and she genuinely cared about her students. I have always struggled in calculus but she made it so easy and she was clearly passionate about the subject! She also offers lots of extra credit and she truly wants you to succeed!
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She was the best math teacher i ever had. She is very passionate about math which made the class very interesting. I did struggle a bit because i couldn't go to the reviews but still liked her. She tries to make connections with her students and is a very genuine person. I wish she could teach all my math classes!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: She was a little unorganized and sometimes forgot to teach us material until the day before the test. Her quizzes and tests are graded pretty tough. You have very little wiggle room for error.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Caring--Tough grader

comment: Mrs. Yeboah is a funny and caring teacher but she wasn't very organized in my calc 1 class. It may have been because my class was her first calc class ever. She is a tough grader and would take weeks at times to return grades. This made things more confusing in an already difficult class. However, she does drop the lowest test grade and 2 quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: This professor wants you to do well. She is there for you if you need help. With that said, it is Calculus, so it is not a breeze. You need to be prepared for class always, and be on top of studying from day one. She gives extra credit, but please do not rely on it. Be ready for quizzes, those are the hardest part of the class, exams are not bad.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This woman will go to the ends of the earth to help you learn. I cant say enough good things about her. I was really struggling, but she helped me during office hours. She is an awesome teacher who truly cares!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: This class was okay I received an A and that was only because I'm good at math however I had some friends in the class failing because of how she teaches so if you love math and can teach yourself go ahead!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Loved this professor and class! She was super nice and genuinely loved Calculus which made the class fun for us. 7 quizzes but 3 get dropped. 4 exams and your 2 lowest homeworks get dropped. Final replaces lowest quiz grade. Would definitely take this professor again. She's so sweet and nice and cares about her students' success.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: she can be a little all over the place and sometimes condescending but a decent teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Very late to classes, jumps around topics, covers very little course material. Tests did not reflect what was taught in class and time was wasted during class tremendously over topics outside the classroom. KSU math department needs help with lack of good professors and tutoring center needs just as much help as well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She explains very well and always stops to ask questions, but you have to study outside of the classroom because the subject is hard. She moves quizzes if she feels like the students in the class are not ready to take it. Very flexible office hours, I really recommend schedule appointments with her, trust me, it will benefit you a lot.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Takes forever to grade, like weeks over the time she says she'll have them graded. Always moves quizzes and tests without notice and cancels classes at the last minute. Moves very fast and doesn't explain well. I've always done very well in other math courses, and this is the only one I've ever struggled in.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: She's pretty great. If you show up and pay attention, you'll do great. She will break things down until they make sense, which I found very valuable because math has never been my strong suit. And she's sweet! 9/10, would choose her again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Please do not take this professor. She does not explain things well and takes a very long time to grade. If you don't understand the material she blames it on you or the entire class for not understanding basic concepts when she is the one not being consistent with her teaching. She made math so much more confusing for me.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Her class was the most boring class this entire semester. On top of that, she took FOREVER to grade things. I still have things not graded and the semester is already over, and it was from the beginning of the this school semester. Honestly, find another professor who doesnt lecture you on life when you are simply trying to ask how to do a problem
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER FOR ELEMENTARY APPLIED CALCULUS! I went to class and SI sessions and have failed. She takes forever to grade and doesnt explain things well. I heard she is a better proffessor in Math 1111. BUT DO NOT TAKE HER SO MATH 1160

She is very inconsistent with what she teaches in class and what she puts on her tests and quizzes. She expects you to go to the SI sessions on your own time, when you should be learning all you need directly from her (which is hard if you have other classes or a job). She takes forever to grade and is very rude to her many confused students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Even if you aren't the best at math, you can still do great in this class. Prof Yeboah really helps work through the problems and gives great study guides. Not exactly an easy A, but if you work a little for it you can definitely get it. Homework grades and quizzes contribute  a lot to your grade. You don't have to take the final if you have an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Miss Annas class is an easy A if you a.) Do the homework on mymathlab, b.) Listen and pay attention to her lectures, and c.) Ask for help. She is very easy to talk to, as she really wants you to pass. She is also very loud in her lectures, so its hard not to pay attention during her class. Overall, Miss Anna is a great math teacher. TAKE HER!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took her College Algebra class my first semester. I SUCK AT MATH! But with her help I passed with a high B and that's really rare for me. I loved her plus she's really nice and clearly cares for her students.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Inspirational--Would take again

comment: Professor Yeboah is super nice and willing to help you as much as she can, however, if math is not your strong subject (which it is not mine), I don't recommend her. She moves way too fast and it's hard to keep up, and I struggled a LOT in this class because of it. Other than that, though, she's very sweet and offers lots of extra credit and help.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I wouldn't say that she is a bad teacher but if math is not your strong subject then look somewhere else for a prof. She moves much quicker than she needs to which can make it very difficult to grasp concepts, even more so if you struggle with math already. Also, she seems like she is making it a goal to be intimidating.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: Ms. Anna is a great math professor and I am taking her next semester. Its easy to understand her. Lots of tests and quizzes, but that way u can mess up a little and it won't be a big deal. She gives PLENTY of extra credit. I think I got a 99 bc there was so much extra credit. Didnt have to take the final bc I had an A already! Very caring lady!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Love her! She takes everything really slow if you don't understand it and has office hours every week. Really super helpful! If you can, take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Would take again

comment: She is not a bad professor, she kind of rushes a bit which doesn't give you enough time to fully understand. She does ask "is there any questions?" frequently, so she does want you to understand and cares. If you don't understand in class she advices you to office during her office hours.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Terrible teacher
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's okay. If math isn't your strongest subject, take another teacher. I've always done well in math but didn't do as well as normal. She does offer extra help with a little bit of extra credit. She is available in her office but if you don't go to class or keep up with the homework, you won't do well. She's a nice lady but her tests are hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Good teacher, very nice and cares about her students. Im not very good at math so this class was tough, but she does have study sessions and if you go to her during her office hours she will help you! No multiple choice on tests or quizzes but she does give extra credit. It also takes her a while getting things graded.
rating_tags: Caring--TEST HEAVY--Clear grading criteria

comment: Shes super sweet and wants everyone to succeed. She teaches well and if you need help she is available. I thought the class was super easy but a lot dropped. Theres homework but you have a lot of time to do it. She doesnt give pop quizzes ever and tests are easier than homework.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: A lot people for some reason struggled in this class and even dropped it, but I thought it was rather easy. If you pay attention and understand basic math you'll do just fine. Also, the homework is always harder than the actual quizzes. Ms. Anna is a nice teacher but doesn't put up with immaturity and nonsense so don't mess around.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT
